pages.text: Diskagma is a poorly understood multcellular organism found in terrestrial soils from the Rhyacian period in what is now South Africa. While it has been tentatively classified as a fungus in the division glomeromycota, the extreme age of the fossils casts doubt on this, as they pre-date the commonly accepted origin of eukaryotic life by at least 400 million years, as well as the possibly eukaryotic Francevillian biota by 100 million years.
